snippet: Two cases test the country’s pride in protecting individual liberty even as other European nations have taken stands on the issue.
abstract: London judge decides that Muslim woman standing trial on charges of intimidating a witness can attend court wearing her facial veil, but must remove it to give evidence so the jury can better evaluate her claims; ruling, combined with withdrawal of ban on face coverings at Birmingham Metropolitan College suggest that it is becoming increasingly hard for the government to remain quiet about an issue that has already prompted legislation in Continental Europe.
lead_paragraph: Two cases test the country’s pride in protecting individual liberty even as other European nations have taken stands on the issue.

headline.main: Britain Is Pulled, Reluctantly, Into Debate Over Wearing Full-Face Veils in Public
headline.print_headline: Britain Is Pulled, Reluctantly, Into Debate Over Wearing Full-Face Veils in Public
